docs.snippet: The justices ruled unanimously that states may count all residents in drawing election districts. As a practical matter, the ruling mostly helped Democrats....
docs.lead_paragraph: The justices ruled unanimously that states may count all residents in drawing election districts. As a practical matter, the ruling mostly helped Democrats.
docs.abstract: Supreme Court rules unanimously that states can count all residents, whether or not they are eligible to vote, in drawing election districts; decision, which rejects challenge to principle of 'one person one vote,' benefits mostly Democrats because of demographics of their base.

headline.main: Supreme Court Rejects Challenge on ‘One Person One Vote’
headline.print_headline: Justices Reject Challenge on ‘One Person One Vote’

docs.snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron and his family do not benefit from any offshore funds, his spokesman said on Tuesday, after the British leader came under pressure over his late father's inclusion in the "Panama Papers" revelations over tax havens....
docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron and his family do not benefit from any offshore funds, his spokesman said on Tuesday, after the British leader came under pressure over his late father's inclusion in the "Panama Papers" revelations over tax havens.

headline.main: Cameron, Under Pressure From 'Panama Papers', Says He Does Not Benefit From Offshore Funds
headline.print_headline: Cameron, Under Pressure From 'Panama Papers', Says He Does Not Benefit From Offshore Funds

docs.snippet: Iceland's embattled prime minister, facing accusations of conflict of interest because of offshore accounts, stepped aside Tuesday and proposed that the vice chairman of his party take over....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iceland's embattled prime minister, facing accusations of conflict of interest because of offshore accounts, stepped aside Tuesday and proposed that the vice chairman of his party take over.

headline.main: Icelandic PM Proposes Party's Vice Chairman Take Over
headline.print_headline: Icelandic PM Proposes Party's Vice Chairman Take Over
